TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit RelationshipQuery extends System.Management.WqlObjectQuery

Docs.summary: Represents a WQL *REFERENCES OF* data query.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. This is the default constructor.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string queryOrSourceObject) cil managed

Docs.param: The query string or the class name for this query.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. If the specified string can be successfully parsed as a WQL query, it is considered to be the query string; otherwise, it is assumed to be the path of the source object for the query. In this case, the query is assumed to be an instances query.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
## Examples The following example sets the type of relationship between a WMI class and a <xref:System.Management.RelatedObjectQuery>.
[!code-csharp[wminet_RelationshipQuery(S)#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WindowsServer/wminet_RelationshipQuery(S)/cs/RelationshipQuery(S).cs#1)] [!code-vb[wminet_RelationshipQuery(S)#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WindowsServer/wminet_RelationshipQuery(S)/vb/RelationshipQuery(S).vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string sourceObject, string relationshipClass) cil managed

Docs.param: The path of the source object for this query.
The type of relationship for which to query.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class for the given source object and relationship class. The query is assumed to be an instance query (as opposed to a schema query).

remarks.format:

MemberSignature.Value: public RelationshipQuery (bool isSchemaQuery, string sourceObject, string relationshipClass, string relationshipQualifier, string thisRole);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(bool isSchemaQuery, string sourceObject, string relationshipClass, string relationshipQualifier, string thisRole) cil managed

Docs.param: to indicate that this is a schema query; otherwise, .
The path of the source class for this query.
The type of relationship for which to query.
A qualifier required to be present on the relationship class.
The role that the source class is required to play in the relationship.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class for a schema query using the given set of parameters. This constructor is used for schema queries only, so the first parameter must be true.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).

MemberSignature.Value: public RelationshipQuery (string sourceObject, string relationshipClass, string relationshipQualifier, string thisRole, bool classDefinitionsOnly);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string sourceObject, string relationshipClass, string relationshipQualifier, string thisRole, bool classDefinitionsOnly) cil managed

Docs.param: The path of the source object for this query.
The type of relationship for which to query.
A qualifier required to be present on the relationship object.
The role that the source object is required to play in the relationship.
When this method returns, it contains a Boolean that indicates that only class definitions for the resulting objects are returned.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class for the given set of parameters. The query is assumed to be an instance query (as opposed to a schema query).

remarks.format:
## Remarks
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyorassemblyhidebysig instance void BuildQuery() cil managed

Docs.summary: Builds the query string according to the current property values.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating that only the class definitions of the relevant relationship objects be returned.
Docs.value: Returns a value indicating that only the class definitions of the relevant relationship objects be returned.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Setting this property value overrides any previous value stored in the object. As a side-effect, the query string is rebuilt to reflect the new flag.
## Property Value `true` if the query requests only class definitions of the result set; otherwise, `false`.
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).

Docs.summary: Creates a copy of the object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this query is a schema query or an instance query.
Docs.value: Returns a value indicating whether this query is a schema query.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Setting this property value overrides any previous value stored in the object. The query string is rebuilt to reflect the new query type.
## Property Value `true` if this query should be evaluated over the schema; `false` if the query should be evaluated over instances.
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the class of the relationship objects wanted in the query.
Docs.value: Returns a value containing the relationship class name.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Setting this property value overrides any previous value stored in the object. The query string is rebuilt to reflect the new class.

## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the source object for this query.
Docs.value: Returns a value containing the path of the object to be used for the query.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Setting this property value overrides any previous value stored in the object. The query string is rebuilt to reflect the new source object.
## Property Value A string representing the path of the object to be used for the query.
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
